definition: abbr. for mathematics 數學|数学[shu4 xue2], physics 物理[wu4 li3] and chemistry 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: 'They only pay attention to physics, mathematics and chemistry, ' says Mr. Pei.
sentences.chinese: 裴东光说，他们只关心数理化。

sentences.chinese: 裴东光说，他们只关心数理化。

sentences.english: In the school, it is likewise important that environmental science and number manage are changed.
sentences.chinese: 在学校里，环境科学与数理化同样重要。

sentences.english: My total score of math, physics and chemistry at the end-term examination is 360.
sentences.chinese: 这次期末考试我的数理化三科总分是360分。

sentences.english: Physics and chemistry are very few women at home, is a proof.
sentences.chinese: 数理化家们极少女性，也是一种明证。

definition: literature and language/(PRC) Chinese (as a school subject)
the sciences (as opposed to the humanities 文科[wen2 ke1])
physics and chemistry/to govern and educate
to take extra lessons in a cram school or with a private tutor
to overemphasize some topic (at the expense of others)/overdoing it/to go overboard
